    • AddAppointmentWindowController

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes all ID's in the master list to be used in generating a new ID. Initializes all contacts in the masterList from the database so that the names can be extracted. Lambda is used set the allContactNames list to a list of strings comprised of the contactName portion of the contact list.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - A Url.
      resourceBundle - A ResourceBundle.

    • okButtonClicked

      public void okButtonClicked() throws java.lang.Exception
      Calls the validateInput method so that the data provided by the user can be validated/checked for errors. If there are no errors, the data is written to the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the EditDatabase class.
      See Also:
      EditDatabase

    • cancelButtonClicked

      public void cancelButtonClicked() throws java.io.IOException
      Sets the scene back to the main schedule window.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if there is an error loading the FXML file.

    • validateInput

      public boolean validateInput() throws java.lang.Exception
      Validates the input provided by the user. Editable fields cannot be empty/unselected. The appropriate data types must be given or an Alert Box will be displayed.
      Returns:
      Returns True if all if statements fail.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the DateAndTime or Fetcher classes.
      See Also:
      DateAndTime, Fetcher, Alerts

    • setNextId

      public void setNextId​(javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.Integer> idList)
      Sets the next available ID given a list of ID's.
      Parameters:
      idList - An ObservableList of integers.

    • getNextId

      public int getNextId()
      Gets the next available ID.
      Returns:
      Returns the next available ID as an integer.

    • setAllContactNames

      public void setAllContactNames​(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Contact> contacts)
      Creates a list of contact names by iterating through a list of contacts and getting the names.
      Parameters:
      contacts - a list of contacts to iterate through and extract names from.

    • getAllContactNames

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> getAllContactNames()
      Gets all Contact Names.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList of Contact Names.
